channel.title: Security Now (Audio)
channel.itunes:author: TWiT
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons License - Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International - http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/
channel.itunes:subtitle: Steve Gibson discusses the hot topics in security today with Leo Laporte.
channel.itunes:summary:
Steve Gibson, the man who coined the term spyware and created the first anti-spyware program, creator of Spinrite and ShieldsUP, discusses the hot topics in security today with Leo Laporte.
Records live every Tuesday at 4:30pm Eastern / 1:30pm Pacific / 20:30 UTC.
channel.description:
Steve Gibson, the man who coined the term spyware and created the first anti-spyware program, creator of Spinrite and ShieldsUP, discusses the hot topics in security today with Leo Laporte.
Records live every Tuesday at 4:30pm Eastern / 1:30pm Pacific / 20:30 UTC.
channel.itunes:keywords: TWiT, Technology, Steve Gibson, Leo Laporte, security, spyware, malware, hacking, cyber crime, emcryption

item.title: SN 820: The Dark Escrow - Firefox Fission, Doom CAPTCHA, Conti and CNA Financial Ransomware
item.itunes:title: The Dark Escrow - Firefox Fission, Doom CAPTCHA, Conti and CNA Financial Ransomware
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Firefox Fission, Doom CAPTCHA, Conti and CNA Financial Ransomware
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, firefox, firefox fission, firefox browser security, conti gang, conti ransomware, ransomware, CNA financial, cna security, cna ransomware, iot, iot security, mean time to inventory, doom captcha, captcha
item.description:
• Picture of the Week.
  • Firefox finally achieves sustained "Fission".
  • Conti ransomware.
  • CNA Financial pays up big.
  • When they say IoT do they mean us?
  • "Mean Time to Inventory"
  • The "Doom" CAPTCHA.
  • The "Helios" screensaver.
  • Closing the Loop.
  • The Dark Escrow.

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-820-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

Get episodes ad-free with Club TWiT at https://twit.tv/clubtwit

You can submit a question to Security Now! at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

Sponsors:

  • Melissa.com/twit
  • udacity.com/TWiT offer code TWIT75
  • expressvpn.com/securitynow

item.title: SN 819: The WiFi Frag Attacks - DarkSide Follow-Up, DarkTracer, Patch Tuesday, The Frontiers Saga
item.itunes:title: The WiFi Frag Attacks - DarkSide Follow-Up, DarkTracer, Patch Tuesday, The Frontiers Saga
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: DarkSide Follow-Up, DarkTracer, Patch Tuesday, The Frontiers Saga
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, darkside hack, pipeline hack, darkside ransomware, pipeline ransomware, colonial pipeline, darktracer, darkweb, toshiba, Microsoft, patch tuesday, frontiers saga, uap, unidentified aerial phenomena
item.description:
• Picture of the week.
  • DarkSide Follow-Up.
  • Follow The Money.
  • Toshiba Attacked by DarkSide.
  • Ransomware topics off-limits here.
  • "DarkTracer: DarkWeb Criminal Intelligence"
  • Please Leak our Stolen Data!
  • Patch Tuesday Review.
  • A review of the first book of "The Frontiers Saga"
  • 60 Minutes/UAP: Unidentified Aerial Phenomena.
  • Closing the Loop.
  • The WiFi Frag Attacks.

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-819-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

Get episodes ad-free with Club TWiT at https://twit.tv/clubtwit

You can submit a question to Security Now! at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

Sponsors:

  • barracuda.com/securitynow
  • wwt.com/twit
  • extrahop.com/SECURITYNOW

item.title: SN 818: News From the Darkside - Exim Email Server, Tor's Exit Nodes, TsuNAME, Project Hail Mary
item.itunes:title: News From the Darkside - Exim Email Server, Tor's Exit Nodes, TsuNAME, Project Hail Mary
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Exim Email Server, Tor's Exit Nodes, TsuNAME, Project Hail Mary
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, TsuNAME, dns, domain name system, cisco, Google, two-step verification, 2FA, automatic enrollment, Exim, eMail transfer agent, e-soft, 21 nails, tor, exit nodes, vpn, https-only browser, project hail mary
item.description:
• Picture of the week.
  • TsuNAME - "DNS Configuration Flaw Lets Attackers Take Down DNS Servers"
  • Huh Google?
  • Tor's Exit Nodes.
  • 21 Nails in Exim's coffin.
  • Project Hail Mary: A Novel.
  • Closing the loop.
  • SpinRite update.
  • News from the Darkside.

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-818-Notes.pdf

item.title: SN 817: The Ransomware Task Force - Scripps Health, REvil Hacks Quanta Computer, Emotet Botnet, QNAP
item.itunes:title: The Ransomware Task Force - Scripps Health, REvil Hacks Quanta Computer, Emotet Botnet, QNAP
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Scripps Health, REvil Hacks Quanta Computer, Emotet Botnet, QNAP
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, revil, Apple, quanta, quanta computer, quanta hack, revil hack, scripps hack, scripps health, scripps security, emotet botnet, botnet defeat, emotet security, haveibeenpwned, qnap, gravity nntp
item.description:
• Picture of the Week.
  • REvil hacks Apple supplier Quanta Computer.
  • World-famous Scripps Health taken down.
  • The Big Emotet Botnet Takedown.
  • Emotet's 4,324,770 eMail addresses.
  • Have I Been Pwned domain-wide notifications.
  • QNAP.
  • Gravity NNTP Newsreader updated to v3.0.11.0
  • Just a bit more about Dan Kaminsky.
  • Closing the Loop.
  • The Ransomware Task Force.

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-817-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

Get episodes ad-free with Club TWiT at https://twit.tv/clubtwit

You can submit a question to Security Now! at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

Sponsors:

  • itpro.tv/securitynow promo code SN30
  • vee.am/securitynow
  • audible.com/securitynow or text securitynow to 500-500

item.title: SN 816: The Mystery of AS8003 - Remembering Dan Kaminsky, Project Zero, Unethical Security Research
item.itunes:title: The Mystery of AS8003 - Remembering Dan Kaminsky, Project Zero, Unethical Security Research
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Remembering Dan Kaminsky, Project Zero, Unethical Security Research
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, patch tuesday, Microsoft, Windows, project zero, Google, google project, ethical security, security research, cloudflare, patent troll, cloudflar patent, as8003, pentagon, pentagon IP, dan kaminsky
item.description:
• Remembering Dan Kaminsky.
  • Week before last was Patch Tuesday.
  • Google's Project Zero responds to today's patch latency reality.
  • Baking security into IoT
  • UNethical security research.
  • CloudFlare refuses to knuckle under to Patent Trolls.
  • Closing The Loop.
  • The Mystery of AS8003.

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-816-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

Get episodes ad-free with Club TWiT at https://twit.tv/clubtwit

You can submit a question to Security Now! at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

Sponsors:

  • extrahop.com/SECURITYNOW
  • barracuda.com/securitynow
  • plextrac.com/twit

item.title: SN 815: Homogeneity Attacks - Is FLoC All That Bad?, Humble Bundle For Programmers, Chrome 90
item.itunes:title: Homogeneity Attacks - Is FLoC All That Bad?, Humble Bundle For Programmers, Chrome 90
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Is FLoC All That Bad?, Humble Bundle For Programmers, Chrome 90
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, floc, vivaldi floc, vivaldi project, chrome, exchange server, exchange server web shells, wordpress floc, Humble Bundle, programming books, SpinRite, chrome v90, chrome 90, floc id, vaccination passport
item.description:
• Club TWiT details.
  • Picture of the Week.
  • The Vivaldi Project's take on FLoC.
  • Chrome continues to be THE high-value target.
  • We're at Chrome v90.
  • Exchange Server Web Shells removed, with DOJ Permission.
  • WordPress joins the "FLoC No!" chorus.
  • It's Humble Bundle Book Time.
  • Closing the Loop.
  • A quick SpinRite progress report.
  • Homogeneity Attacks.

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-815-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

Get episodes ad-free with Club TWiT at https://twit.tv/clubtwit

You can submit a question to Security Now! at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

Sponsors:

  • Melissa.com/twit
  • thehelm.com/securitynow
  • expressvpn.com/securitynow

item.description:
• Picture of the week.
  • The Slips keep Streaming.
  • Are You FLoC'ed?
  • The PHP GIT Hack, revisited.
  • CISCO abandons old routers having problems.
  • Failure to Patch.
  • PwnIt And OwnIt.

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-814-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

You can submit a question to Security Now! at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

item.title: SN 813: A Spy in Our Pocket - Ubiquity Coverup, Facebook Data Dump, Malicious Call of Duty Cheats
item.itunes:title: A Spy in Our Pocket - Ubiquity Coverup, Facebook Data Dump, Malicious Call of Duty Cheats
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Ubiquity Coverup, Facebook Data Dump, Malicious Call of Duty Cheats
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, ubiquiti, qnap, nas security, nas storage, call of duty malware, call of duty cheats, warzone cheats, warzone malware, android app permissions, android permissions, app permissions, water supply hack
item.description:
Ubiquity coverup, Facebook data dump, malicious Call of Duty cheats.

  • The Ubiquiti Coverup.
  • Facebook's 533,313,128 Million User Whoopsie!
  • Don't mess with our water!
  • Android moves to limit inter-app visibility.
  • Beware malicious "Call of Duty: Warzone" cheats.
  • QNAP — Just Say No!
  • Listener Feedback.
  • A Spy in Our Pocket.

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-813-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Jason Howell

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

You can submit a question to Security Now! at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

  • vee.am/securitynow
  • itpro.tv/securitynow promo code SN30
  • Bandwidth.com/SecurityNow

item.title: SN 812: GIT Me Some PHP - Spectre Returns to Linux, API Security, OpenSSL Flaws, SolarWinds
item.itunes:title: GIT Me Some PHP - Spectre Returns to Linux, API Security, OpenSSL Flaws, SolarWinds
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Spectre Returns to Linux, API Security, OpenSSL Flaws, SolarWinds
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, proxylogon, spectre, linux, spectre linux, openssl flaws, openssl fixes, solarwinds code, solarwinds vulnerability, solarwinds, cloudflare, api security, SpinRite, PHP, github, php github
item.description:
Spectre returns to Linux, API Security, OpenSSL flaws, SolarWinds.

  • Picture of the week.
  • ProxyLogon Update.
  • Spectre returns to Linux.
  • OpenSSL fixes several high-severity flaws.
  • SolarWinds keeps finding new critical problems within its own code.
  • Cloudflare's recent moves.
  • A focus on API Security.
  • SpinRite update.
  • The curious case of the PHP's Git Server Hack.

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-812-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

You can submit a question to Security Now! at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

Sponsors:

  • plextrac.com/twit
  • thehelm.com/securitynow

item.title: SN 811: What the FLoC? - Automatic Fix for Exchange Server Flaw, Firefox 87 Features, MyBB Patch
item.itunes:title: What the FLoC? - Automatic Fix for Exchange Server Flaw, Firefox 87 Features, MyBB Patch
item.itunes:author: TWiT
item.itunes:subtitle: Automatic Fix for Exchange Server Flaw, Firefox 87 Features, MyBB Patch
item.itunes:keywords: Security Now, TWiT, steve gibson, Leo Laporte, dave's garage, Microsoft, proxylogon microsoft, microsoft security, firefox privacy, firefox referrer, referrer policy, rced, remote code execution disasters, mybb patch, mybb, caid, flock, Google FLoC
item.description:
Automatic fix for Exchange Server flaw, Firefox 87 features, MyBB patch.

  • Dave's Garage on YouTube.
  • The latest update on the ProxyLogon fiasco is from Microsoft.
  • Black Kingdom Ransomware.
  • Firefox will be adopting a new privacy-enhancing Referrer Policy.
  • This Week in Remote Code Execution Disasters.
  • MyBB gets patched.
  • CAID is able.
  • What the FLoC? "Federated Learning of Cohorts"

We invite you to read our show notes at https://www.grc.com/sn/SN-811-Notes.pdf

Hosts: Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte

Download or subscribe to this show at https://twit.tv/shows/security-now.

You can submit a question to Security Now! at the GRC Feedback Page.

For 16kbps versions, transcripts, and notes (including fixes), visit Steve's site: grc.com, also the home of the best disk maintenance and recovery utility ever written Spinrite 6.

Sponsors:

  • expressvpn.com/securitynow
  • extrahop.com/SECURITYNOW
  • Melissa.com/twit
